docs.snippet: By the arrival of the Saxonia and Edinburgh at this port, and of the Europa at Halifax, our European advices are carried to Oct. 9. they are unusually destitute of importance. Two French ships of war have been dispatched to Lisbon to obtain the...
docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival of the Saxonia and Edinburgh at this port, and of the Europa at Halifax, our European advices are carried to Oct. 9. they are unusually destitute of importance. Two French ships of war have been dispatched to Lisbon to obtain the restoration of the ship Charles Georges, seized by a Portuguese frigate in the Mozambique Channel as a slaver. From India the intelligence is of interest.

docs.snippet: The march between Mr. MORPHY and Mr. HARRWITZ has proceeded another stage, the former having the advantage. It will be remembered that the first two games of this Combat inured to Mr. HARRWITZ, after which four were played. Mr. MORPHY being the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The march between Mr. MORPHY and Mr. HARRWITZ has proceeded another stage, the former having the advantage. It will be remembered that the first two games of this Combat inured to Mr. HARRWITZ, after which four were played. Mr. MORPHY being the victor. Mr. HARRWITZ, on a plea of ill-health, postponed the further prosecution of the fight for sometime, until on the 29th alt. it was resumed.

headline.main: EUROPE.; INTERESTING MISCELLANEOUS INTELLIGENCE, Cotton Unchanged - Breadstuffs Dull - Consols 98 1-4@98 3-4. Arrival of the Europa at Halifax. ADVICES THREE DAYS LATER. Hopeful View of the Condition of the Atlantic Telegraph.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamship Europa, Capt. LEITCH, from Liverpool at 10 1/2 o'clock on the morning of the 9th inst., arrived at this port at 12 o'clock last night. Her dates are three days later than those already received. Among her passengers are the Hon. HENRY J. RAYMOND, of the NEW-YORK TIMES, and Judge PUTNAM, of Boston.

docs.snippet: The steamship Anglo-Saxon, from Liverpool 6th inst., arrived this morning. Her news has been anticipated by the dispatch from the Ariel off Cape Race. A careful examination of our files, however, gives us some little additional news of interest....

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Lady Franklin's Arctic Expedition -- Conceded Failure of the Present Atlantic Cable-- Proposed Federation of the British American Colonies, c. Magnetic Telegraph Company's Offices - Nos. 43 Wall-street and Astor House. Arrival of the Anglo-Saxon at Quebec. ADDITIONAL EUROPEAN NEWS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Anglo-Saxon, from Liverpool 6th inst., arrived this morning. Her news has been anticipated by the dispatch from the Ariel off Cape Race. A careful examination of our files, however, gives us some little additional news of interest. Later advices from Lady FRANKLIN's Arctic yacht Fox, mention that the expedition had safely crossed the middle ice of Baffin's Sea, and was in a fair way of accomplishing the object of the enterprise.

docs.snippet: The Vanderbilt United States Mail steamer Ariel, Captain LUDLOW, from Bremen and Havre via Southampton Oct. 6, passed Cape Race on Sunday, the 17th inst., at 5 o'clock, P. M. The Ariel has 250 passengers for New-York. Her news reached here to-day....

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; By the Newfoundland and American Telegraph Company's Lines--Office No. 21 Wall-street.] Cotton Steady--Breadstuffs Tending Downsward--Consols 98 to 98 1-4. NO IMPROVEMENT IN THE WORKING OF THE CABLE. Magnetic Telegraph Company's Offices--No. 43 Wall-street and Astor House. FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE. THE ARIEL OFF CAPE RACE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Vanderbilt United States Mail steamer Ariel, Captain LUDLOW, from Bremen and Havre via Southampton Oct. 6, passed Cape Race on Sunday, the 17th inst., at 5 o'clock, P. M. The Ariel has 250 passengers for New-York. Her news reached here to-day. There is no improvement in the working of the Atlantic Cable at Valentia.

docs.snippet: MARTIN.--In this City on Sunday, Oct. 17, after a short illness, CATHERINE M. MARTIN, aged 23 years 6 months and 17 days. Her friends and relatives are respectfully invited to attend the funeral, from No. 137 West 17th-st., on (this) Tuesday, Oct....
docs.lead_paragraph: MARTIN.--In this City on Sunday, Oct. 17, after a short illness, CATHERINE M. MARTIN, aged 23 years 6 months and 17 days. Her friends and relatives are respectfully invited to attend the funeral, from No. 137 West 17th-st., on (this) Tuesday, Oct. 13, at 12 M. Her remains will be taken to Greenwood.

docs.snippet: The Construction Committee of the Commissloners of Emigration, Mayor TIEMANN, Chairman, visited the Quarantine grounds, Saturday, to inspect the work of the contractors, who are busily engaged in rebuilding tile Hospitals. They find the work going on...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Construction Committee of the Commissloners of Emigration, Mayor TIEMANN, Chairman, visited the Quarantine grounds, Saturday, to inspect the work of the contractors, who are busily engaged in rebuilding tile Hospitals. They find the work going on rapidly, and in accordance with the plans and specifications. The Hospital buildings, which will first be needed by the sick.

docs.snippet: The State Department has received no communication from the Society Islands on the subject of annexation. The paper presented by Count SARTIGES asked the withdrawal from these Islands of two Americans who were intermeddling in their political...

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; FROM WASHINGTON. Magnetic Telegraph Company's Offices--Nos. 43 Wall-street and Astor House. The Society Islands Affair--The Paraguay Expedition--Land-office Decisions, etc.

docs.lead_paragraph: The State Department has received no communication from the Society Islands on the subject of annexation. The paper presented by Count SARTIGES asked the withdrawal from these Islands of two Americans who were intermeddling in their political affairs. The American Consul refused to forward the paper, and hence it was sent through French officials.

docs.snippet: The English Mail Company's steamer Clyde will leave here early to-morrow morning, and I embrace the opportunity of writing, although there is really nothing of importance to communicate since your last dates from this place.

headline.main: NICARAGUA.; Movements of Our Squadron--The Opening of the Transit--A British Aggression--The Renowned Col. Cauty--His Autecedents--The Only Hope of Nicaragua--Movements of Gen. Lamar--Arrival of the Cass-Yrissari.

docs.lead_paragraph: The English Mail Company's steamer Clyde will leave here early to-morrow morning, and I embrace the opportunity of writing, although there is really nothing of importance to communicate since your last dates from this place.
